column4: Which is the best tool to erase DVDRW in Ubuntu? K3B, Gnomebaker doesn't erase the DVD at all.
How do I configure the networkssettings in the terminal? I totally forgot and don't have a clue where to begin to look.
ifconfig
if you have DHCP you can connect with dhclient <interface-name>
It's fine now, but not on the temporary connection which is another place then at home.
I see.  the quick and dirty way to put an ip address on a network interface is just ifconfig <interface-name> <ip-address> netmask <netmask>
then type route add default gw <default gateway ip adddress>
That's the way I prefer, but how to write it is something I'm unsure off.
Can you take it again in PM?
Thanks.
I'm pm'ing you now.
it's all there in the PM are you still here?
or are you not getting the messages because I'm forgetting something?
I get them.
Sorry. Hold a minute.
so those commands will change your ip address temporarily, but they'll be wiped out when you reboot
I need to register the name with the password. Just hold until I can find the note.
/msg nickserv register <user-name>
/msg nickserv identify <password>
/join #fkf9f0f0fkffjfkjf
I'm getting an error message when I do that, why don't we just pm I just saw your last message
I can't for some reason. Did you get my "testmessages?"
